comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
This is a Central Mexican Rail Road train, locomotive Nr. 18.  The Central Mexican joined México City to Paso del Norte (Ciudad Juárez) border to El Paso, Texas.   I am from Torreón, Coahuila.   This railroad company reached my city on 1883 and when this hapened the line
was done. Five years later the International Mexican reached Torreón causing the town to develop at gigant steps.  The line joined Ciudad Porfirio Díaz (Piedras Negras), border to Eagle Pass, Tex. and Durango, México.  The locomotive model seems to be from those years
up to 1890. Today the place most likely might be Avenida de los Arcos and Boulevard Bernardo  Quintana, Querétaro City (capital of the state of the same name), México.
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Plastic Surgeon
dr.robertoduarte@hotmail.com
